alert.note: Alert for Lemhi (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 27 at 6:01PM MST until November 27 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: The National Weather Service in Missoula has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Central Lemhi County in east central Idaho... * Until 700 PM MST. * At 601 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located near Salmon, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Flash freeze on roads. Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Locations impacted include... Salmon, North Fork, Carmen and Baker. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges, and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for a sudden loss of traction. Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
